result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett L. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Minus bond on deposit.  Work out payment plan with agent for any balance due.
Minus bond on deposit.  Work out payment plan with agent for any balance due.

Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.
Obtain GED or HSED.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 3-11-16
Pay DNA surcharge.

No contact with G.C., K.S., A.H. or their immediate families.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to consume or possess any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
AODA followed by treatment and aftercare.

timeConds.notes:

Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
